reviews.text: Little bit old and run down feel like it could be brightened up however it has  some nice views and restaurants which serve good food
10/10 people nice lovley rain food great

Judging by some of the photos uploaded and the previous reviews written it seems some people have confused this railway station with the narrow gauge railway stations on the Ffestiniog and Highland Railways.  This is the "proper" station and lies on the Cambrian Coast line which runs between Birmingham and Shrewsbury in the east and Pwllheli in the West.  The station is just outside Porthmadog town centre and whilst it's a bit basic (one eastbound and one westbound platform) the old station building has been converted into a pub called the Station Inn so if you find yourself having to wait for a train there's somewhere on site to seek shelter.
A stunningly beautiful North Wales town in a stunningly beautiful part of Wales.
